   20: -module(code_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: -include_lib("syntax_tools/include/merl.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   26: -export([set_path/1, get_path/1, add_path/1, add_paths/1, del_path/1,
   27: 	 replace_path/1, load_file/1, load_abs/1,
   28:          ensure_loaded/1, ensure_loaded_many/1, ensure_loaded_many_kill/1,
   29:          ensure_loaded_bad_case/1,
   30: 	 delete/1, purge/1, purge_many_exits/0, purge_many_exits/1,
   31:          soft_purge/1, is_loaded/1, all_loaded/1, all_available/1,
   32: 	 load_binary/1, dir_req/1, object_code/1, set_path_file/1,
   33: 	 upgrade/0, upgrade/1,
   34: 	 sticky_dir/1, add_del_path/1,
   35:          pa_pz_option/1, remove_pa_pz_option/1,
   36: 	 dir_disappeared/1, ext_mod_dep/1, clash/1,
   37: 	 where_is_file/1,
   38: 	 purge_stacktrace/1, mult_lib_roots/1, bad_erl_libs/1,
   39: 	 code_archive/1, code_archive2/1, on_load/1,
   40:      on_load_binary/1, on_load_binary_twice/1,
   41: 	 on_load_embedded/1, on_load_errors/1, on_load_update/1,
   42:          on_load_trace_on_load/1,
   43: 	 on_load_purge/1, on_load_self_call/1, on_load_pending/1,
   44: 	 on_load_deleted/1, on_load_deadlock/1,
   45: 	 big_boot_embedded/1,
   46:          module_status/1,
   47: 	 get_mode/1, code_path_cache/1,
   48: 	 normalized_paths/1, mult_embedded_flags/1]).
   49: 
   50: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   51: 	 init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   52: 
   53: %% error_logger
   54: -export([init/1,
   55: 	 handle_event/2, handle_call/2, handle_info/2,
   56: 	 terminate/2]).
   57: 
   58: -export([compile_load/4]).
   59: 
   60: suite() ->
   61:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   62:      {timetrap,{seconds,30}}].
   63: 
   64: all() ->
   65:     [set_path, get_path, add_path, add_paths, del_path,
   66:      replace_path, load_file, load_abs,
   67:      ensure_loaded, ensure_loaded_many, ensure_loaded_many_kill,
   68:      ensure_loaded_bad_case,
   69:      delete, purge, purge_many_exits, soft_purge, is_loaded, all_loaded,
   70:      all_available, load_binary, dir_req, object_code, set_path_file,
   71:      upgrade, code_path_cache,
   72:      pa_pz_option, remove_pa_pz_option,
   73:      sticky_dir, add_del_path, dir_disappeared,
   74:      ext_mod_dep, clash, where_is_file,
   75:      purge_stacktrace, mult_lib_roots,
   76:      bad_erl_libs, code_archive, code_archive2, on_load,
   77:      on_load_binary, on_load_binary_twice,
   78:      on_load_embedded, on_load_errors,
   79:      {group, sequence},
   80:      on_load_purge, on_load_self_call, on_load_pending,
   81:      on_load_deleted, on_load_deadlock,
   82:      module_status,
   83:      big_boot_embedded, get_mode, normalized_paths,
   84:      mult_embedded_flags].
   85: 
   86: %% These need to run in order
   87: groups() -> [{sequence, [sequence], [on_load_update,
   88:                                      on_load_trace_on_load]}].
   89: 
   90: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   91: 	Config.
   92: 
   93: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   94: 	Config.
   95: 
   96: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   97:     %% The compiler will no longer create a Beam file if
   98:     %% the module name does not match the filename, so
   99:     %% we must compile to a binary and write the Beam file
  100:     %% ourselves.
  101:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  102:     File = filename:join(Dir, "code_a_test"),
  103:     {ok,code_b_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  104:     ok = file:write_file(File++".beam", Code),
  105:     Config.
  106: 
  107: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  108:     Config.
  109: 
  110: -define(TESTMOD, test_dummy).
  111: -define(TESTMODSTR, "test_dummy").
  112: -define(TESTMODSRC, ?TESTMODSTR ".erl").
  113: -define(TESTMODOBJ, ?TESTMODSTR ".beam").
  114: 
  115: init_per_testcase(big_boot_embedded, Config) ->
  116:     case catch application:start(crypto) of
  117: 	ok ->
  118: 	    init_per_testcase(do_big_boot_embedded, Config);
  119: 	_Else ->
  120: 	    {skip, "Needs crypto!"}
  121:     end;
  122: init_per_testcase(on_load_embedded, Config0) ->
  123:     LibRoot = code:lib_dir(),
  124:     LinkName = filename:join(LibRoot, "on_load_app-1.0"),
  125:     Config = [{link_name,LinkName}|Config0],
  126:     init_per_testcase(Config);
  127: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  128:     init_per_testcase(Config).
  129: 
  130: init_per_testcase(Config) ->
  131:     P = code:get_path(),
  132:     [{code_path, P}|Config].
  133: 
  134: 
  135: end_per_testcase(module_status, Config) ->
  136:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  137:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
  138:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  139:     file:delete(?TESTMODOBJ),
  140:     file:delete(?TESTMODSRC),
  141:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  142: end_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == mult_lib_roots;
  143: 				  TC == big_boot_embedded ->
  144:     {ok, HostName} = inet:gethostname(),
  145:     NodeName = list_to_atom(atom_to_list(TC)++"@"++HostName),
  146:     test_server:stop_node(NodeName),
  147:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  148: end_per_testcase(on_load_embedded, Config) ->
  149:     LinkName = proplists:get_value(link_name, Config),
  150:     _ = del_link(LinkName),
  151:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  152: end_per_testcase(upgrade, Config) ->
  153:     %% Make sure tracing is turned off even if the test times out.
  154:     erlang:trace_pattern({error_handler,undefined_function,3}, false, [global]),
  155:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]),
  156:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  157: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  158:     end_per_testcase(Config).
  159: 
  160: end_per_testcase(Config) ->
  161:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  162:     P=proplists:get_value(code_path, Config),
  163:     true=code:set_path(P),
  164:     P=code:get_path(),
  165:     ok.
  166: 
  167: set_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  168:     P = code:get_path(),
  169:     NonExDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), test_server:temp_name("hej")),
  170:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:set_path({a})),
  171:     {error, bad_directory} = (catch code:set_path([{a}])),
  172:     {error, bad_directory} = code:set_path(NonExDir),
  173:     P = code:get_path(), % still the same path.
  174:     true = code:set_path(P), % set the same path again.
  175:     P = code:get_path(), % still the same path.
  176:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  177:     true = code:set_path([LibDir | P]),
  178:     [LibDir | P] = code:get_path(),
  179:     true = code:set_path([LibDir]),
  180:     [LibDir] = code:get_path(),
  181:     ok.
  182: 
  183: get_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  184:     P = code:get_path(),
  185:     %% test that all directories are strings (lists).
  186:     [] = lists:filter(fun
  187: 	    (Dir) when is_list(Dir) -> false;
  188: 	    (_) -> true
  189: 	end, P),
  190:     ok.
  191: 
  192: add_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  193:     P = code:get_path(),
  194:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_path({})),
  195:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_patha({})),
  196:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_pathz({})),
  197:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_path("xyz"),
  198:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_patha("xyz"),
  199:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_pathz("xyz"),
  200:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  201:     true = code:add_path(LibDir),
  202:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  203:     code:set_path(P),
  204:     true = code:add_pathz(LibDir),
  205:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  206:     code:set_path(P),
  207:     true = code:add_patha(LibDir),
  208:     [LibDir|_] = code:get_path(),
  209:     code:set_path(P),
  210:     ok.
  211: 
  212: add_paths(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  213:     P = code:get_path(),
  214:     ok = code:add_paths([{}]),
  215:     ok = code:add_pathsa([{}]),
  216:     ok = code:add_pathsz([{}]),
  217:     ok = code:add_paths(["xyz"]),
  218:     ok = code:add_pathsa(["xyz"]),
  219:     ok = code:add_pathsz(["xyz"]),
  220:     P = code:get_path(), % check that no directory is added.
  221: 
  222:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  223:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir]),
  224:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  225:     code:set_path(P),
  226:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir]),
  227:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  228:     code:set_path(P),
  229:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir]),
  230:     [LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  231:     code:set_path(P),
  232: 
  233:     RootDir = code:root_dir(),
  234:     Res = P ++ [LibDir, RootDir],
  235:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir, RootDir]),
  236:     Res = code:get_path(),
  237:     code:set_path(P),
  238:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir, RootDir]),
  239:     Res = code:get_path(),
  240:     code:set_path(P),
  241:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir, RootDir]),
  242:     [RootDir, LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  243:     code:set_path(P),
  244: 
  245:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  246:     Res1 = P ++ [LibDir],
  247:     Res1 = code:get_path(),
  248:     code:set_path(P),
  249:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  250:     Res1 = code:get_path(),
  251:     code:set_path(P),
  252:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  253:     [LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  254:     code:set_path(P),
  255:     ok.
  256: 
  257: del_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  258:     P = code:get_path(),
  259:     try
  260: 	del_path_1(P)
  261:     after
  262: 	code:set_path(P)
  263:     end.
  264: 
  265: del_path_1(P) ->
  266:     io:format("Initial code:get_path()=~p~n",[P]),
  267:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:del_path(3)),
  268:     false = code:del_path(my_dummy_name),
  269:     false = code:del_path("/kdlk/my_dummy_dir"),
  270:     Dir = filename:join([code:lib_dir(kernel),"ebin"]),
  271:     io:format("kernel dir: ~p~n",[Dir]),
  272: 
  273:     true = code:del_path(kernel),
  274:     NewP = code:get_path(),
  275:     io:format("Path after removing 'kernel':~p~n",[NewP]),
  276:     ReferenceP = lists:delete(Dir,P),
  277:     io:format("Reference path:~p~n",[ReferenceP]),
  278:     NewP = ReferenceP, % check that dir is deleted
  279:     code:set_path(P),
  280: 
  281:     %% An superfluous "/" should also work.
  282:     true = code:del_path("kernel/"),
  283:     NewP = ReferenceP,			   % check that dir is deleted
  284:     code:set_path(P),
  285: 
  286:     true = code:del_path(Dir),
  287:     NewP1 = code:get_path(),
  288:     NewP1 = lists:delete(Dir,P), % check that dir is deleted
  289:     ok.
  290: 
  291: replace_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  292:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  293:     P = code:get_path(),
  294:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:replace_path(3,"")),
  295:     {error, bad_name} = code:replace_path(dummy_name,""),
  296:     {error, bad_name} = code:replace_path(kernel,
  297: 						"/kdlk/my_dummy_dir"),
  298:     {error, bad_directory} = code:replace_path(kernel,
  299: 						     "/kdlk/kernel-1.2"),
  300:     P = code:get_path(), % Check that path is not changed.
  301: 
  302:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  303: 
  304:     %% Replace an existing application.
  305: 
  306:     file:make_dir("./kernel-2.11"),
  307:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  308:     NewDir = Cwd ++ "/kernel-2.11",
  309:     true = code:replace_path(kernel, NewDir),
  310:     NewDir = code:lib_dir(kernel),
  311:     true = code:set_path(P),			%Reset path
  312:     ok = file:del_dir("./kernel-2.11"),
  313: 
  314:     %% Add a completely new application.
  315: 
  316:     NewAppName = 'blurf_blarfer',
  317:     NewAppDir = filename:join(Cwd, atom_to_list(NewAppName) ++ "-6.33.1"),
  318:     ok = file:make_dir(NewAppDir),
  319:     true = code:replace_path(NewAppName, NewAppDir),
  320:     NewAppDir = code:lib_dir(NewAppName),
  321:     NewAppDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  322:     true = code:set_path(P),			%Reset path
  323:     ok = file:del_dir(NewAppDir),
  324: 
  325:     ok.
  326: 
  327: code_path_cache(Config) ->
  328:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  329: 
  330:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify dummy name not in path
  331:     code:purge(?TESTMOD), % ensure no previous version in memory
  332:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
  333:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  334: 
  335:     Original = code:get_path(),
  336:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "myebin"),
  337:     filelib:ensure_path(Dir),
  338:     ToBeReplacedDir1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "tobereplaced-1/ebin"),
  339:     ToBeReplacedDir2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "tobereplaced-2/ebin"),
  340:     filelib:ensure_path(ToBeReplacedDir1),
  341:     filelib:ensure_path(ToBeReplacedDir2),
  342: 
  343:     File = filename:join(Dir, ?TESTMODOBJ),
  344:     {ok,?TESTMOD,Bin} = compile:forms(dummy_ast(), []),
  345: 
  346:     %% Adding a cached path and re-adding for clearing
  347:     [begin
  348:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  349:         true = code:Fun(Dir, cache),
  350:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  351:         ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  352:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  353:         true = code:Fun(Dir, cache),
  354:         {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  355:         code:del_path(Dir),
  356:         ok = file:delete(File)
  357:      end || Fun <- [add_path, add_patha, add_pathz]],
  358: 
  359:     Original = code:get_path(),
  360: 
  361:     %% Adding several cached paths and explicit cache clearing
  362:     [begin
  363:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  364:         ok = code:Fun([Dir, ToBeReplacedDir1], cache),
  365:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  366:         ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  367:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  368:         ok = code:clear_cache(),
  369:         {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  370:         ok = code:del_paths([Dir, ToBeReplacedDir1]),
  371:         ok = file:delete(File)
  372:      end || Fun <- [add_paths, add_pathsa, add_pathsz]],
  373: 
  374:     Original = code:get_path(),
  375: 
  376:     %% Replacing a non-cached path with cache and set_path for clearing
  377:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  378:     true = code:add_path(ToBeReplacedDir1),
  379:     true = code:replace_path(tobereplaced, ToBeReplacedDir2, cache),
  380:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  381:     ok = file:write_file(filename:join(ToBeReplacedDir2, ?TESTMODOBJ), Bin),
  382:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  383:     true = code:set_path(code:get_path(), nocache),
  384:     {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  385: 
  386:     true = code:set_path(Original),
  387:     ok.
  388: 
  389: %% OTP-3977.
  390: dir_disappeared(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  391:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  392:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "temp"),
  393:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  394:     true = code:add_path(Dir),
  395:     ok = file:del_dir(Dir),
  396:     non_existing = code:which(bubbelskrammel),
  397:     ok.
  398: 
  399: load_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  400:     {error, nofile} = code:load_file(duuuumy_mod),
  401:     {error, badfile} = code:load_file(code_a_test),
  402:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:load_file(123)),
  403:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_file(code_b_test),
  404:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  405:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  406:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_file(code_b_test),
  407:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  408:     ok.
  409: 
  410: test_dir() ->
  411:     filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)).
  412: 
  413: load_abs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  414:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  415:     {error, nofile} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/duuuumy_mod"),
  416:     {error, badfile} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_a_test"),
  417:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:load_abs({})),
  418:     {error, nofile} = code:load_abs("Non-latin-имя-файла"),
  419:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  420:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  421:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  422:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  423:     ok.
  424: 
  425: ensure_loaded_bad_case(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  426:     %% Make sure loading an invalid .beam file does
  427:     %% not hold a permanent lock on the server.
  428:     {error, _} = code:ensure_loaded('STRING'),
  429:     {error, _} = code:ensure_loaded('STRING'),
  430:     ok.
  431: 
  432: ensure_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  433:     {module, lists} = code:ensure_loaded(lists),
  434:     case init:get_argument(mode) of
  435: 	{ok, [["embedded"] | _]} ->
  436: 	    {error, embedded} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  437: 	    {error, badarg} = code:ensure_loaded(34),
  438: 	    ok;
  439: 	_ ->
  440: 	    {error, nofile} = code:ensure_loaded(duuuumy_mod),
  441: 	    {error, badfile} = code:ensure_loaded(code_a_test),
  442: 	    {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:ensure_loaded(34)),
  443: 	    {module, code_b_test} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  444: 	    {module, code_b_test} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  445: 	    ok
  446:     end.
  447: 
  448: ensure_loaded_many(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  449:     with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, fun(Node) ->
  450:         %% Without special handling for async loading in code server,
  451:         %% this operation seemed to consistently take 5s+
  452:         Action = fun() ->
  453:             Self = self(),
  454:             Fun = fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test), Self ! {done, self()} end,
  455:             Pids = [spawn(Fun) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 1_000)],
  456:             [receive {done, Pid} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  457:             ok
  458:         end,
  459:         ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [Action, []], 1_000)
  460:     end).
  461: 
  462: ensure_loaded_many_kill(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  463:     with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, fun(Node) ->
  464:         Action = fun() ->
  465:             Self = self(),
  466:             Fun = fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test), Self ! {done, self()} end,
  467:             sys:suspend(code_server),
  468:             First = spawn_opt(Fun, [{priority, max}]),
  469:             Pids = [spawn(Fun) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 1_000)],
  470:             sys:resume(code_server),
  471:             exit(First, kill),
  472:             [receive {done, Pid} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  473:             {file, _} = code:is_loaded(code_b_test),
  474:             ok
  475:         end,
  476:         ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [Action, []])
  477:     end).
  478: 
  479: with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, Fun) ->
  480:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  481:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  482:     ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [fun set_up_large_loadpath/1, [Priv]]),
  483:     try Fun(Node)
  484:     after peer:stop(Peer)
  485:     end.
  486: 
  487: set_up_large_loadpath(Priv) ->
  488:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  489:     Dirs = [filename:join(Priv, integer_to_list(N)) || N <- lists:seq(1, 500)],
  490:     [ok = filelib:ensure_path(Dir) || Dir <- Dirs],
  491:     [true = code:add_patha(Dir) || Dir <- Dirs],
  492:     ok.
  493: 
  494: delete(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  495:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  496:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  497:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  498:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  499:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:delete(122)),
  500:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  501:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  502:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  503:     exit(Pid,kill),
  504:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  505:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  506:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  507:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  508:     ok.
  509: 
  510: purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  511:     run_purge_test(fun purge_test/1, Config).
  512: 
  513: purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  514:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  515:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  516:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:purge({})),
  517:     false = code:purge(code_b_test),
  518:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  519:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  520:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  521:     true = code:purge(code_b_test),
  522:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  523:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  524:     ok.
  525: 
  526: purge_many_exits() ->
  527:     [{timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
  528: 
  529: purge_many_exits(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  530:     run_purge_test(fun purge_many_exits_test/1, Config).
  531: 
  532: purge_many_exits_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  533:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  534: 
  535:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  536:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:purge({})),
  537: 
  538:     CodePurgeF = fun(M, Exp) -> Exp = code:purge(M) end,
  539:     purge_many_exits_do(CodePurgeF),
  540: 
  541:     %% Let's repeat test for erlang:purge_module as it does the same thing
  542:     %% now in erts-8.0 (except for return value).
  543:     ErlangPurgeF = fun(M, _Exp) -> erlang:purge_module(M) end,
  544:     purge_many_exits_do(ErlangPurgeF),
  545: 
  546:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  547:     ok.
  548: 
  549: 
  550: purge_many_exits_do(PurgeF) ->
  551:     false = code:purge(code_b_test),
  552:     TPids = lists:map(fun (_) ->
  553: 			      {code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  554: 			       spawn_link(fun () ->
  555: 						  receive
  556: 						  after infinity -> ok
  557: 						  end
  558: 					  end)}
  559: 			 end,
  560: 			 lists:seq(1, 1000)),
  561:     %% Give them time to start...
  562:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  563:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  564:     lists:foreach(fun ({Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  565: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid1),
  566: 			  false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid1),
  567: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid2)
  568: 		  end, TPids),
  569:     PurgeF(code_b_test, true),
  570:     lists:foreach(fun ({Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  571: 			  false = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid1),
  572: 			  true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid1),
  573: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid2),
  574: 			  exit(Pid2, kill)
  575: 		  end, TPids),
  576:     lists:foreach(fun ({_Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  577: 			  receive {'EXIT', Pid2, _} -> ok end
  578: 		  end, TPids).
  579: 
  580: 
  581: soft_purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  582:     run_purge_test(fun soft_purge_test/1, Config).
  583: 
  584: soft_purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  585:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  586:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  587:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:soft_purge(23)),
  588:     true = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  589:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  590:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  591:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  592:     false = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  593:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  594:     exit(Pid,kill),
  595:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  596:     true = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  597:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  598:     ok.
  599: 
  600: is_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  601:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  602:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  603:     false = code:is_loaded(duuuuuumy_mod),
  604:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:is_loaded(23)),
  605:     {file, preloaded} = code:is_loaded(init),
  606:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  607:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  608:     {file, _Loaded} = code:is_loaded(code_b_test),
  609:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  610:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  611:     ok.
  612: 
  613: all_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  614:     case test_server:is_cover() of
  615: 	true -> {skip,"Cover is running"};
  616: 	false -> all_loaded_1()
  617:     end.
  618: 
  619: all_loaded_1() ->
  620:     Preloaded = [{M,preloaded} || M <- lists:sort(erlang:pre_loaded())],
  621: 
  622:     Loaded0 = lists:sort(code:all_loaded()),
  623:     all_unique(Loaded0),
  624:     Loaded1 = lists:keysort(2, Loaded0),
  625:     Loaded2 = match_and_remove(Preloaded, Loaded1),
  626: 
  627:     ObjExt = code:objfile_extension(),
  628:     [] = lists:filter(fun
  629: 	    ({Mod,AbsName}) when is_atom(Mod), is_list(AbsName) ->
  630: 		Mod =/= list_to_atom(filename:basename(AbsName, ObjExt));
  631: 	    (_) -> true
  632: 	end, Loaded2),
  633:     ok.
  634: 
  635: match_and_remove([], List) -> List;
  636: match_and_remove([X|T1], [X|T2]) -> match_and_remove(T1, T2).
  637: 
  638: all_unique([]) -> ok;
  639: all_unique([_]) -> ok;
  640: all_unique([{X,_}|[{Y,_}|_]=T]) when X < Y -> all_unique(T).
  641: 
  642: all_available(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  643:     case test_server:is_cover() of
  644: 	true -> {skip,"Cover is running"};
  645: 	false -> all_available_1(Config)
  646:     end.
  647: 
  648: all_available_1(Config) ->
  649: 
  650:     %% Add an ez dir to make sure the modules in there are found
  651:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config)++"clash/",
  652:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1.ez/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  653: 
  654:     Available = code:all_available(),
  655: 
  656:     %% Test that baz and blarg that are part of the .ez archive are found
  657:     {value, _} =
  658:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,Loaded}) -> not Loaded andalso Name =:= "baz" end, Available),
  659:     {value, _} =
  660:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,Loaded}) -> not Loaded andalso Name =:= "blarg" end, Available),
  661: 
  662:     %% Test that all loaded are part of all available
  663:     Loaded = [{atom_to_list(M),P,true} || {M,P} <- code:all_loaded()],
  664:     [] = Loaded -- Available,
  665: 
  666:     {value, {ModStr,_,false} = NotLoaded} =
  667:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,Loaded}) -> not is_atom(Name) end, Available),
  668:     ct:log("Testing with ~p",[NotLoaded]),
  669: 
  670:     Mod = list_to_atom(ModStr),
  671: 
  672:     %% Test that the module is actually not loaded
  673:     false = code:is_loaded(Mod),
  674: 
  675:     %% Load it
  676:     Mod:module_info(),
  677: 
  678:     {value, {ModStr,_,true}} =
  679:         lists:search(fun({Name,_,_}) -> Name =:= ModStr end, code:all_available()),
  680: 
  681:     ok.
  682: 
  683: load_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  684:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  685:     File = TestDir ++ "/code_b_test" ++ code:objfile_extension(),
  686:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File),
  687:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(12, File, Bin)),
  688:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(code_b_test, 12, Bin)),
  689:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, 12)),
  690:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, Bin),
  691:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  692:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, Bin),
  693:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  694:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  695:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  696:     ok.
  697: 
  698: 
  699: upgrade() ->
  700:     [{timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
  701: 
  702: upgrade(Config) ->
  703:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  704:     upgrade_do(DataDir, beam, [beam]),
  705:     ok.
  706: 
  707: upgrade_do(DataDir, Client, T) ->
  708:     compile_load(upgrade_client, DataDir, undefined, Client),
  709:     [upgrade_client:run(DataDir, U1, U2, O1, O2)
  710:      || U1<-T, U2<-T, O1<-T, O2<-T],
  711:     ok.
  712: 
  713: compile_load(Mod, Dir, Ver, CodeType) ->
  714:     %%erlang:display({"{{{{{{{{{{{{{{{{Loading",Mod,Ver,CodeType}),
  715:     Version = case Ver of
  716: 	undefined ->
  717: 	    io:format("Compiling '~p' as ~p\n", [Mod, CodeType]),
  718: 	    [];
  719: 	_ ->
  720: 	    io:format("Compiling version ~p of '~p' as ~p\n",
  721: 		[Ver, Mod, CodeType]),
  722: 	    [{d,list_to_atom("VERSION_" ++ integer_to_list(Ver))}]
  723:     end,
  724: 
  725:     CompOpts = [binary, report] ++ Version,
  726: 
  727:     Src = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl"),
  728:     T1 = erlang:now(),
  729:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(Src, CompOpts),
  730:     T2 = erlang:now(),
  731:     ObjFile = filename:basename(Src,".erl") ++ ".beam",
  732:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, ObjFile, Code),
  733:     T3 = erlang:now(),
  734:     io:format("Compile time ~p ms, Load time ~p ms\n",
  735: 	      [timer:now_diff(T2,T1) div 1000, timer:now_diff(T3,T2) div 1000]),
  736:     %%erlang:display({"}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}Loaded",Mod,Ver,CodeType}),
  737:     ok.
  738: 
  739: dir_req(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  740:     {ok,[[Root0]]} = init:get_argument(root),
  741:     Root = filename:join([Root0]),	% Normalised form.
  742:     Root = code:root_dir(),
  743:     LibDir = Root ++ "/lib",
  744:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  745:     code:compiler_dir(),
  746:     {error, bad_name} = code:lib_dir(duuumy),
  747:     KernLib = code:lib_dir(kernel),
  748:     Priv = KernLib ++ "/priv",
  749:     Priv = code:priv_dir(kernel),
  750:     {error, bad_name} = code:priv_dir(duuumy),
  751:     ok.
  752: 
  753: object_code(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  754:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  755:     P = code:get_path(),
  756:     P = code:get_path(),
  757:     code:add_path(TestDir),
  758:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  759:     LoadedFile = filename:absname(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test" ++
  760: 				  code:objfile_extension()),
  761:     case code:get_object_code(code_b_test) of
  762: 	      {code_b_test,Bin,LoadedFile} when is_binary(Bin) ->
  763: 		  ok
  764: 	  end,
  765:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  766:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  767:     error = code:get_object_code(dddddddduuuuuuumy),
  768:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:get_object_code(23)),
  769:     code:set_path(P),
  770:     P=code:get_path(),
  771:     ok.
  772: 
  773: %% Test that set_path does not accept
  774: %% files as pathnames (known previous bug)
  775: set_path_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  776:     File=filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "testfil"),
  777:     ok=file:write_file(File, list_to_binary("lite data")),
  778:     {error, bad_directory}=code:set_path([File]).
  779: 
  780: %% Test that a module with the same name as a module in
  781: %% a sticky directory cannot be loaded.
  782: sticky_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  783:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  784:     Mods = [code,lists,erlang,init],
  785:     OutDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), sticky_dir),
  786:     _ = file:make_dir(OutDir),
  787:     Ret = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply,
  788: 		   [fun sticky_compiler/2,[Mods,OutDir]]),
  789:     case Ret of
  790: 	[] ->
  791: 	    ok;
  792: 	Other ->
  793: 	    io:format("~p\n", [Other]),
  794: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  795:     end,
  796:     peer:stop(Peer),
  797:     ok.
  798: 
  799: sticky_compiler(Files, PrivDir) ->
  800:     code:add_patha(PrivDir),
  801:     Rets = [do_sticky_compile(F, PrivDir) || F <- Files],
  802:     [R || R <- Rets, R =/= ok].
  803: 
  804: do_sticky_compile(Mod, Dir) ->
  805:     case code:is_sticky(Mod) of
  806:         true ->
  807:             %% Make sure that the module is loaded. A module being sticky
  808:             %% only prevents it from begin reloaded, not from being loaded
  809:             %% from the wrong place to begin with.
  810:             Mod = Mod:module_info(module),
  811:             File = filename:append(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod)),
  812:             Src = io_lib:format("-module(~s).\n"
  813:                                 "-export([test/1]).\n"
  814:                                 "test(me) -> fail.\n", [Mod]),
  815:             ok = file:write_file(File++".erl", Src),
  816:             case c:c(File, [{outdir,Dir}]) of
  817:                 {ok,Module} ->
  818:                     Module:test(me);
  819:                 {error,sticky_directory} ->
  820:                     ok
  821:             end;
  822:         false ->
  823:             %% For some reason the module is not sticky
  824:             %% could be that the .erlang file has
  825:             %% unstuck it?
  826:             {Mod, is_not_sticky}
  827:     end.
  828: 
  829: %% Test that the -pa and -pz options work as expected.
  830: pa_pz_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  831:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  832:     PaDir = filename:join(DDir,"pa"),
  833:     PzDir = filename:join(DDir,"pz"),
  834:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-pa", PaDir, "-pz", PzDir]),
  835:     Ret=rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
  836:     [PaDir|Paths] = Ret,
  837:     [PzDir|_] = lists:reverse(Paths),
  838:     peer:stop(Peer),
  839:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(["-mode", "embedded", "-pa",
  840:         PaDir, "-pz", PzDir]),
  841:     Ret2=rpc:call(Node2, code, get_path, []),
  842:     [PaDir|Paths2] = Ret2,
  843:     [PzDir|_] = lists:reverse(Paths2),
  844:     peer:stop(Peer2).
  845: 
  846: %% Test that we can remove paths added via -pa and -pz.
  847: remove_pa_pz_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  848:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  849:     PaDir = filename:join(DDir,"clash/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  850:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-pa", PaDir]),
  851:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [blarg]),
  852:     true = rpc:call(Node, code, del_path, [PaDir]),
  853:     error = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [blarg]),
  854:     peer:stop(Peer).
  855: 
  856: %% add_path, del_path should not cause priv_dir(App) to fail.
  857: add_del_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  858:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  859:     Dir1 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-1.0/ebin"),
  860:     Dir2 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-2.0/ebin"),
  861:     code:add_patha(Dir1),
  862:     PrivDir1 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-1.0/priv"),
  863:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  864:     code:add_path(Dir2), % put last in path
  865:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  866:     code:del_path(Dir2),
  867:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  868:     ok.
  869: 
  870: 
  871: clash(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  872:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config)++"clash/",
  873:     P = code:get_path(),
  874: 
  875:     %% test non-clashing entries
  876: 
  877:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  878:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"zork-0.8/ebin"),
  879:     ct:capture_start(),
  880:     ok = code:clash(),
  881:     ct:capture_stop(),
  882:     [OKMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  883:     true = lists:prefix("** Found 0 name clashes", OKMsg),
  884:     true = code:set_path(P),
  885: 
  886:     %% test clashing entries
  887: 
  888:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  889:     true = code:add_path(DDir++"foobar-0.1.ez/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  890:     ct:capture_start(),
  891:     ok = code:clash(),
  892:     ct:capture_stop(),
  893:     [ClashMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  894:     {match, [" hides "]} = re:run(ClashMsg, "\\*\\* .*( hides ).*",
  895: 					[{capture,all_but_first,list}]),
  896:     true = code:set_path(P),
  897: 
  898:     %% test "Bad path can't read"
  899: 
  900:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  901:     TmpEzFile = Priv++"foobar-0.tmp.ez",
  902:     {ok, _} = file:copy(DDir++"foobar-0.1.ez", TmpEzFile),
  903:     true = code:add_path(TmpEzFile++"/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  904:     case os:type() of
  905:         {win32,_} ->
  906: 	    %% The file won't be deleted on windows until it's closed, why we
  907: 	    %% need to rename instead.
  908: 	    ok = file:rename(TmpEzFile,TmpEzFile++".moved");
  909: 	 _ ->
  910:     	    ok = file:delete(TmpEzFile)
  911:     end,
  912:     ct:capture_start(),
  913:     ok = code:clash(),
  914:     ct:capture_stop(),
  915:     [BadPathMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  916:     true = lists:prefix("** Bad path can't read", BadPathMsg),
  917:     true = code:set_path(P),
  918:     file:delete(TmpEzFile++".moved"), %% Only effect on windows
  919:     ok.
  920: 
  921: %% Every module that the code_server uses should be preloaded,
  922: %% this test case verifies that.
  923: ext_mod_dep(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  924:     xref:start(s),
  925:     xref:set_default(s, [{verbose,false},{warnings,false},
  926: 			 {builtins,true},{recurse,true}]),
  927:     xref:set_library_path(s, code:get_path()),
  928:     xref:add_directory(s, filename:join(code:lib_dir(kernel),"ebin")),
  929:     xref:add_directory(s, filename:join(code:lib_dir(stdlib),"ebin")),
  930:     case catch ext_mod_dep2() of
  931: 	{'EXIT', Reason} ->
  932: 	    xref:stop(s),
  933: 	    exit(Reason);
  934: 	Else ->
  935:     	    xref:stop(s),
  936: 	    case Else of
  937: 		ok -> ok;
  938: 		_ -> ct:fail(Else)
  939: 	    end
  940:     end.
  941: 
  942: ext_mod_dep2() ->
  943:     Exports0 = code_server:module_info(exports) --
  944: 	[{module_info,0},{module_info,1}],
  945:     Exports = [{code_server,M,A} || {M,A} <- Exports0],
  946:     case analyse(Exports, [], [], 0) of
  947: 	{_Visited,0} ->
  948: 	    ok;
  949: 	{_Visited,ErrCnt} ->
  950: 	    {not_verified,ErrCnt}
  951:     end.
  952: 
  953: analyse([], [], Visited, ErrCnt) ->
  954:     {Visited,ErrCnt};
  955: analyse([], [This={M,F,A}|Path], Visited, ErrCnt0) ->
  956:     %% The code_server has been granted to use the following modules,
  957:     %% These modules should be loaded by code.erl before
  958:     %% the code_server is started.
  959:     OK = [erlang, os, prim_file, erl_prim_loader, init, ets,
  960: 	  code_server, lists, lists_sort, unicode, binary, filename,
  961: 	  gb_sets, gb_trees, erts_code_purger, erts_internal, code,
  962: 	  prim_zip, zlib],
  963:     ErrCnt1 =
  964: 	case lists:member(M, OK) or erlang:is_builtin(M,F,A) of
  965: 	    true ->
  966: 		0;
  967: 	    false ->
  968: 		check_funs(This, Path)
  969: 	end,
  970:     {Visited, ErrCnt1+ErrCnt0};
  971: analyse([MFA|R], Path, Visited0, ErrCnt0) ->
  972:     case lists:member(MFA,Visited0) of
  973: 	false ->
  974: 	    {Visited,ErrCnt1} = analyse2(MFA, Path, Visited0),
  975: 	    analyse(R, Path, Visited, ErrCnt1+ErrCnt0);
  976: 	true ->
  977: 	    analyse(R, Path, Visited0, ErrCnt0)
  978:     end.
  979: 
  980: analyse2(MFA = {'$M_EXPR',_, _}, Path, Visited0) ->
  981:     analyse([], [MFA|Path], Visited0, 0);
  982: analyse2(MFA={_,_,_}, Path, Visited0) ->
  983:     {ok, FL} = xref:analyze(s,{call,MFA}),
  984:     analyse(FL, [MFA|Path], my_usort([MFA|Visited0]), 0).
  985: 
  986: %%%% We need to check these manually...
  987: %% fun's are ok as long as they are defined locally.
  988: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  989: 	   [{unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
  990: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
  991: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
  992: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  993: 	   [{unicode,ml_map,3},
  994: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
  995: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
  996: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
  997: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  998: 	   [{unicode,do_o_binary2,2},
  999: 	    {unicode,do_o_binary,2},
 1000: 	    {unicode,o_trans,1},
 1001: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
 1002: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
 1003: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
 1004: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1005: 	   [{code_server,do_mod_call,4},
 1006: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3}|_]) -> 0;
 1007: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1008: 	   [{lists,flatmap_1,2},
 1009: 	    {lists,flatmap,2},
 1010: 	    {lists,concat,1},
 1011: 	    {code_server,load_abs,4},
 1012: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3},
 1013: 	    {code_server,loop,1}|_]) -> 0;
 1014: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1015: 	   [{lists,foreach_1,2},
 1016: 	    {lists,foreach,2},
 1017: 	    {code_server,stick_dir,3},
 1018: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3},
 1019: 	    {code_server,loop,1}|_]) -> 0;
 1020: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1021: 	   [{lists,all,2},
 1022: 	    {code_server,is_numstr,1},
 1023: 	    {code_server,is_vsn,1},
 1024: 	    {code_server,vsn_to_num,1},
 1025: 	    {code_server,create_bundle,2},
 1026: 	    {code_server,choose_bundles,1},
 1027: 	    {code_server,make_path,2},
 1028: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs_1,1},
 1029: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs,0},
 1030: 	    {code_server,init,3},
 1031: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1032: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1033: 	   [{lists,all_1,2},
 1034: 	    {lists,all,2},
 1035: 	    {code_server,is_numstr,1},
 1036: 	    {code_server,is_vsn,1},
 1037: 	    {code_server,vsn_to_num,1},
 1038: 	    {code_server,create_bundle,2},
 1039: 	    {code_server,choose_bundles,1},
 1040: 	    {code_server,make_path,2},
 1041: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs_1,1},
 1042: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs,0},
 1043: 	    {code_server,init,3},
 1044: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1045: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1046: 	   [{lists,filter,2},
 1047: 	    {code_server,try_archive_subdirs,3}|_]) -> 0;
 1048: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1049: 	   [{erlang,apply,2},
 1050: 	    {erlang,spawn_link,1},
 1051: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1052: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1053: 	   [{erlang,spawn_link,1},{code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1054: check_funs({'$M_EXPR',warning_msg,2},
 1055: 	   [{code_server,finish_on_load_report,2} | _]) -> 0;
 1056: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1057: 	   [{code_server,run,2}|_]) -> 0;
 1058: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1059: 	   [{code_server,handle_on_load,5}|_]) -> 0;
 1060: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1061: 	   [{code_server,handle_pending_on_load,4}|_]) -> 0;
 1062: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1063: 	   [{code_server,finish_on_load_2,3}|_]) -> 0;
 1064: check_funs(This, Path) ->
 1065:     io:format("not_verified(~p, ~p)~n", [This, Path]),
 1066:     1.
 1067: 
 1068: my_usort(List) ->
 1069:     lists:reverse(uniq(lists:sort(List),[])).
 1070: 
 1071: uniq([],A) ->
 1072:     A;
 1073: uniq([H|T],[]) ->
 1074:     uniq(T,[H]);
 1075: uniq([H|T],[H|_]=A) ->
 1076:     uniq(T,A);
 1077: uniq([H|T],A) ->
 1078:     uniq(T,[H|A]).
 1079: 
 1080: 
 1081: where_is_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1082:     {T,KernelBeamFile} = timer:tc(code, where_is_file, ["kernel.beam"]),
 1083:     io:format("Load time: ~w ms~n", [T]),
 1084:     KernelEbinDir = filename:dirname(KernelBeamFile),
 1085:     AppFile = filename:join(KernelEbinDir, "kernel.app"),
 1086:     AppFile = code:where_is_file("kernel.app"),
 1087:     non_existing = code:where_is_file("kernel"), % no such file
 1088:     ok.
 1089: 
 1090: %% Test that stacktrace is deleted when purging a referred module.
 1091: purge_stacktrace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1092:     run_purge_test(fun purge_stacktrace_test/1, Config).
 1093:     
 1094: purge_stacktrace_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1095:     code:purge(code_b_test),
 1096:     try code_b_test:call(fun(b) -> ok end, a)
 1097:     catch
 1098: 	error:function_clause:Stacktrace ->
 1099: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1100: 	    case Stacktrace of
 1101: 		      [{?MODULE,_,[a],_},
 1102: 		       {code_b_test,call,2,_},
 1103: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1104: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1105: 		  end
 1106:     end,
 1107:     try code_b_test:call(nofun, 2)
 1108:     catch
 1109: 	error:function_clause:Stacktrace2 ->
 1110: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1111: 	    case Stacktrace2 of
 1112: 		      [{code_b_test,call,[nofun,2],_},
 1113: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1114: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1115: 		  end
 1116:     end,
 1117:     Args = [erlang,error,[badarg]],
 1118:     try code_b_test:call(erlang, error, [badarg,Args])
 1119:     catch
 1120: 	error:badarg:Stacktrace3 ->
 1121: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1122: 	    case Stacktrace3 of
 1123: 		      [{code_b_test,call,Args,_},
 1124: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1125: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1126: 		  end
 1127:     end,
 1128:     ok.
 1129: 
 1130: mult_lib_roots(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1131:     DataDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mult_lib_roots"),
 1132:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-b/ebin/lists"),
 1133: 
 1134:     %% We will use this module to test both code path loading and
 1135:     %% code path caching. So we ensure its beam file does not exist.
 1136:     CodeSuiteMultRootBeam =
 1137: 	filename:join(DataDir, "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module.beam"),
 1138:     file:delete(CodeSuiteMultRootBeam),
 1139: 
 1140:     %% Set up ERL_LIBS and start a peer node.
 1141:     ErlLibs = filename:join(DataDir, "first_root") ++ mult_lib_sep() ++
 1142: 	filename:join(DataDir, "second_root"),
 1143: 
 1144:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", ErlLibs]),
 1145: 
 1146:     Path0 = rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
 1147:     %% ?CT_PEER adds extra path to this module folder
 1148:     PathToSelf = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1149:     [PathToSelf, "."|Path1] = Path0,
 1150:     [Kernel|Path2] = Path1,
 1151:     [Stdlib|Path3] = Path2,
 1152:     mult_lib_verify_lib(Kernel, "kernel"),
 1153:     mult_lib_verify_lib(Stdlib, "stdlib"),
 1154:     [Lib1,Lib2,Lib3,Lib4,Lib5|Path] = Path3,
 1155: 
 1156: 
 1157:     ["first_root/my_dummy_app-a/ebin",
 1158:      "first_root/my_dummy_app-b/ebin",
 1159:      "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin",
 1160:      "second_root/my_dummy_app-d/ebin",
 1161:      "second_root/my_dummy_app-e/ebin"] =
 1162: 	[mult_lib_remove_prefix(E, DataDir) ||
 1163: 	    E <- lists:sort([Lib1,Lib2,Lib3,Lib4,Lib5])],
 1164:     io:format("~p\n", [Path]),
 1165: 
 1166:     %% Now let's attempt to dynamically add a module,
 1167:     %% this will fail due to the boot paths cache.
 1168:     error = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1169:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"),
 1170:     error = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1171:     %% Test that the CWD is not cached
 1172:     File = filename:join([DataDir, "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"]),
 1173:     {ok, _} = compile:file(File, [{outdir, "."}]),
 1174:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1175:     true = rpc:call(Node, code_SUITE_mult_root_module, works_fine, []),
 1176:     file:delete("code_SUITE_mult_root_module.beam"),
 1177:     %% Clean up so we can start again
 1178:     file:delete(CodeSuiteMultRootBeam),
 1179:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1180: 
 1181:     NoCacheArgs = ["-env", "ERL_LIBS", ErlLibs, "-cache_boot_paths", "false"],
 1182:     {ok, NoCachePeer, NoCacheNode} = ?CT_PEER(NoCacheArgs),
 1183: 
 1184:     %% Now the same code should work
 1185:     error = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1186:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"),
 1187:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1188:     true = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code_SUITE_mult_root_module, works_fine, []),
 1189: 
 1190:     peer:stop(NoCachePeer),
 1191:     ok.
 1192: 
 1193: mult_lib_compile(Root, Last) ->
 1194:     Mod = list_to_atom(filename:basename(Last)),
 1195:     Name = filename:join([Root,"first_root",Last]),
 1196:     Dir = filename:dirname(Name),
 1197:     {ok,Mod} = compile:file(Name, [report,{outdir,Dir}]),
 1198:     ok.
 1199: 
 1200: mult_lib_sep() ->
 1201:     case os:type() of
 1202: 	{win32,_} -> ";";
 1203: 	_ -> ":"
 1204:     end.
 1205: 
 1206: mult_lib_verify_lib(Path, Expected) ->
 1207:     Dir = filename:basename(filename:dirname(Path)),
 1208:     true = lists:prefix(Expected, Dir).
 1209: 
 1210: mult_lib_remove_prefix([H|T1], [H|T2]) ->
 1211:     mult_lib_remove_prefix(T1, T2);
 1212: mult_lib_remove_prefix([$/|T], []) -> T.
 1213: 
 1214: bad_erl_libs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1215:     %% Preserve ERL_LIBS if set.
 1216:     BadLibs0 = "/no/such/dir",
 1217:     BadLibs =
 1218:          case os:getenv("ERL_LIBS") of
 1219:              false -> BadLibs0;
 1220:              Libs -> BadLibs0 ++ ":" ++ Libs
 1221:          end,
 1222:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1223:     Code = rpc:call(Node,code,get_path,[]),
 1224:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1225: 
 1226:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", BadLibs]),
 1227:     Code2 = rpc:call(Node2,code,get_path,[]),
 1228:     peer:stop(Peer2),
 1229:     %% Test that code path is not affected by the faulty ERL_LIBS
 1230:     Code = Code2,
 1231: 
 1232:     ok.
 1233: 
 1234: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1235: 
 1236: %% Create an archive file containing an application and make use of it.
 1237: 
 1238: code_archive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1239:     do_code_archive(Config, "code_archive_libs", false).
 1240: 
 1241: code_archive2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1242:     do_code_archive(Config, "code_archive_libs2", true).
 1243: 
 1244: do_code_archive(Config, Root, StripVsn) when is_list(Config) ->
 1245:     %% Copy the orig files to priv_dir
 1246:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1247:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1248:     App = code_archive_dict,
 1249:     VsnBase = atom_to_list(App) ++ "-1.0",
 1250:     Base =
 1251: 	case StripVsn of
 1252: 	    true  -> atom_to_list(App);
 1253: 	    false -> VsnBase
 1254: 	end,
 1255:     Ext = init:archive_extension(),
 1256:     RootDir = filename:join([PrivDir, Root]),
 1257:     ok = file:make_dir(RootDir),
 1258:     Archive = filename:join([RootDir, VsnBase ++ Ext]),
 1259:     {ok, _} = zip:create(Archive, [VsnBase],
 1260: 			       [{compress, []}, {cwd, DataDir}]),
 1261:     {ok, _} = zip:extract(Archive, [{cwd, PrivDir}]),
 1262: 
 1263:     case StripVsn of
 1264: 	true ->
 1265: 	    ok = file:rename(filename:join([PrivDir, VsnBase]),
 1266: 				   filename:join([PrivDir, Base]));
 1267: 	false ->
 1268: 	    ok
 1269:     end,
 1270: 
 1271:     io:format("DEBUG: ~p\n", [?LINE]),
 1272:     %% Compile the code
 1273:     ok = compile_app(PrivDir, Base),
 1274: 
 1275:     %% Create the archive
 1276:     ok = file:delete(Archive),
 1277:     {ok, _} = zip:create(Archive, [Base],
 1278: 			       [{compress, []}, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
 1279: 
 1280:     %% Create a directory and a file outside of the archive.
 1281:     OtherFile = filename:join([RootDir,VsnBase,"other","other.txt"]),
 1282:     OtherContents = ?MODULE:module_info(md5),
 1283:     filelib:ensure_dir(OtherFile),
 1284:     ok = file:write_file(OtherFile, OtherContents),
 1285: 
 1286:     %% Set up ERL_LIBS and start a peer node.
 1287:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", RootDir]),
 1288:     CodePath = rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
 1289:     AppEbin = filename:join([Archive, Base, "ebin"]),
 1290:     io:format("AppEbin: ~p\n", [AppEbin]),
 1291:     io:format("CodePath: ~p\n", [CodePath]),
 1292:     io:format("Archive: ~p\n", [erl_prim_loader:read_file_info(Archive)]),
 1293:     true = lists:member(AppEbin, CodePath),
 1294: 
 1295:     %% Start the app
 1296:     ok = rpc:call(Node, application, start, [App]),
 1297: 
 1298:     %% Get the lib dir for the app.
 1299:     AppLibDir = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [App]),
 1300:     io:format("AppLibDir: ~p\n", [AppLibDir]),
 1301:     AppLibDir = filename:join(RootDir, VsnBase),
 1302: 
 1303:     %% Access the app priv dir
 1304:     AppPrivDir = rpc:call(Node, code, priv_dir, [App]),
 1305:     AppPrivFile = filename:join([AppPrivDir, "code_archive.txt"]),
 1306:     io:format("AppPrivFile: ~p\n", [AppPrivFile]),
 1307:     {ok, _Bin, _} =
 1308: 	rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_file, [AppPrivFile]),
 1309: 
 1310:     %% Read back the other text file.
 1311:     OtherDirPath = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [App,other]),
 1312:     OtherFilePath = filename:join(OtherDirPath, "other.txt"),
 1313:     io:format("OtherFilePath: ~p\n", [OtherFilePath]),
 1314:     {ok, OtherContents, _} =
 1315: 	rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_file, [OtherFilePath]),
 1316: 
 1317:     %% Use the app
 1318:     Tab = code_archive_tab,
 1319:     Key = foo,
 1320:     Val = bar,
 1321:     {ok, _Pid} =  rpc:call(Node, App, new, [Tab]),
 1322:     error =  rpc:call(Node, App, find, [Tab, Key]),
 1323:     ok =  rpc:call(Node, App, store, [Tab, Key, Val]),
 1324:     {ok, Val} =  rpc:call(Node, App, find, [Tab, Key]),
 1325:     ok =  rpc:call(Node, App, erase, [Tab, Key]),
 1326:     error =  rpc:call(Node, App, find, [Tab, Key]),
 1327:     ok =  rpc:call(Node, App, erase, [Tab]),
 1328: 
 1329:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1330:     ok.
 1331: 
 1332: compile_app(TopDir, AppName) ->
 1333:     AppDir = filename:join([TopDir, AppName]),
 1334:     SrcDir = filename:join([AppDir, "src"]),
 1335:     OutDir = filename:join([AppDir, "ebin"]),
 1336:     {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(SrcDir),
 1337:     compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir).
 1338: 
 1339: compile_files([File | Files], SrcDir, OutDir) ->
 1340:     case filename:extension(File) of
 1341: 	".erl" ->
 1342: 	    AbsFile = filename:join([SrcDir, File]),
 1343: 	    case compile:file(AbsFile, [{outdir, OutDir}]) of
 1344: 		{ok, _Mod} ->
 1345: 		    compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir);
 1346: 		Error ->
 1347: 		    {compilation_error, AbsFile, OutDir, Error}
 1348: 	    end;
 1349: 	_ ->
 1350: 	    compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir)
 1351:     end;
 1352: compile_files([], _, _) ->
 1353:     ok.
 1354: 
 1355: %% Test that a boot file with (almost) all of OTP can be used to start an
 1356: %% embeddedd system.
 1357: big_boot_embedded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1358:     {BootArg,AppsInBoot} = create_big_boot(Config),
 1359:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-boot", BootArg, "-mode", "embedded"]),
 1360:     RemoteNodeApps =
 1361: 	[ {X,Y} || {X,_,Y} <-
 1362: 		       rpc:call(Node,application,loaded_applications,[]) ],
 1363:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1364:     true = lists:sort(AppsInBoot) =:=  lists:sort(RemoteNodeApps),
 1365:     ok.
 1366: 
 1367: on_load(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1368:     Master = on_load_test_case_process,
 1369: 
 1370:     Data = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),"on_load"]),
 1371:     ok = file:set_cwd(Data),
 1372:     up_to_date = make:all([{d,'MASTER',Master}]),
 1373: 
 1374:     %% Register a name for this process.
 1375:     register(Master, self()),
 1376: 
 1377:     {_,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1378: 					  exit(on_load_a:data())
 1379: 				  end),
 1380:     receive
 1381: 	{on_load_a,start} -> ok
 1382:     end,
 1383:     receive
 1384: 	{on_load_b,start} -> ok
 1385:     end,
 1386:     receive
 1387: 	{on_load_c,PidC} -> ok
 1388:     end,
 1389: 
 1390:     Refs = on_load_massive_spawn(lists:seq(1, 50)),
 1391:     receive after 7 -> ok end,
 1392: 
 1393:     PidC ! go,
 1394: 
 1395:     KernelLibDir = code:lib_dir(kernel),
 1396:     receive
 1397: 	{on_load_c,done} -> ok
 1398:     end,
 1399:     receive
 1400: 	{on_load_b,done} -> ok
 1401:     end,
 1402:     receive
 1403: 	{on_load_a,KernelLibDir} -> ok
 1404:     end,
 1405: 
 1406:     receive
 1407: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,Res} ->
 1408: 	    [a,b,c] = Res
 1409:     end,
 1410: 
 1411:     on_load_wait_for_all(Refs),
 1412:     receive
 1413: 	Any ->
 1414: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Any})
 1415:     after 10 ->
 1416: 	    ok
 1417:     end.
 1418: 
 1419: on_load_massive_spawn([_|T]) ->
 1420:     {_,Ra} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [a,b,c] = on_load_a:data() end),
 1421:     {_,Rb} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [b,c] = on_load_b:data() end),
 1422:     {_,Rc} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [c] = on_load_c:data() end),
 1423:     [Ra,Rb,Rc|on_load_massive_spawn(T)];
 1424: on_load_massive_spawn([]) -> [].
 1425: 
 1426: on_load_wait_for_all([Ref|T]) ->
 1427:     receive
 1428: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,normal} ->
 1429: 	    on_load_wait_for_all(T)
 1430:     end;
 1431: on_load_wait_for_all([]) -> ok.
 1432: 
 1433: on_load_binary(_) ->
 1434:     Master = on_load_binary_test_case_process,
 1435:     register(Master, self()),
 1436: 
 1437:     %% Construct, compile and pretty-print.
 1438:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1439:     File = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
 1440:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1441: 	       "-export([ok/0]).\n",
 1442: 	       "-on_load({init,0}).\n",
 1443: 	       "init() ->\n",
 1444: 	       "  '@Master@' ! {on_load_binary,self()},\n",
 1445: 	       "  receive go -> ok end.\n",
 1446: 	       "ok() -> true.\n"]),
 1447:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1448:     merl:print(Tree),
 1449: 
 1450:     {Pid1,Ref1} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1451: 					code:load_binary(Mod, File, Bin),
 1452: 					true = Mod:ok()
 1453: 				end),
 1454:     receive {Mod,OnLoadPid} -> ok end,
 1455:     {Pid2,Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1456: 					true = Mod:ok()
 1457: 				end),
 1458:     erlang:yield(),
 1459:     OnLoadPid ! go,
 1460:     receive {'DOWN',Ref1,process,Pid1,Exit1} -> ok end,
 1461:     receive {'DOWN',Ref2,process,Pid2,Exit2} -> ok end,
 1462:     normal = Exit1,
 1463:     normal = Exit2,
 1464:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 1465:     false = code:purge(Mod),
 1466:     ok.
 1467: 
 1468: on_load_binary_twice(_) ->
 1469:     Master = on_load_binary_twice_test_case_process,
 1470:     register(Master, self()),
 1471: 
 1472:     %% Construct, compile and pretty-print.
 1473:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1474:     File = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
 1475:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1476:            "-export([ok/0]).\n",
 1477:            "-on_load({init,0}).\n",
 1478:            "init() ->\n",
 1479:            "  '@Master@' ! {on_load_binary_twice,self()},\n",
 1480:            "  receive go -> ok end.\n",
 1481:            "ok() -> true.\n"]),
 1482:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1483:     merl:print(Tree),
 1484: 
 1485:     {Pid1,Ref1} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1486:                     code:load_binary(Mod, File, Bin),
 1487:                     true = Mod:ok()
 1488:                 end),
 1489:     receive {Mod,OnLoadPid1} -> ok end,
 1490:     {Pid2,Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1491:                     code:load_binary(Mod, File, Bin),
 1492:                     true = Mod:ok()
 1493:                 end),
 1494:     erlang:yield(),
 1495: 
 1496:     OnLoadPid1 ! go,
 1497:     receive {'DOWN',Ref1,process,Pid1,Exit1} -> ok end,
 1498:     normal = Exit1,
 1499: 
 1500:     receive {Mod,OnLoadPid2} -> ok end,
 1501:     OnLoadPid2 ! go,
 1502:     receive {'DOWN',Ref2,process,Pid2,Exit2} -> ok end,
 1503:     normal = Exit2,
 1504: 
 1505:     false = code:purge(Mod),
 1506:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 1507:     ok.
 1508: 
 1509: on_load_embedded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1510:     try
 1511: 	on_load_embedded_1(Config)
 1512:     catch
 1513: 	throw:{skip,_}=Skip ->
 1514: 	    Skip
 1515:     end.
 1516: 
 1517: on_load_embedded_1(Config) ->
 1518:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1519:     LinkName = proplists:get_value(link_name, Config),
 1520: 
 1521:     %% Link the on_load_app application into the lib directory.
 1522:     OnLoadApp = filename:join(DataDir, "on_load_app-1.0"),
 1523:     del_link(LinkName),
 1524:     io:format("LinkName :~p, OnLoadApp: ~p~n",[LinkName,OnLoadApp]),
 1525:     case file:make_symlink(OnLoadApp, LinkName) of
 1526: 	{error,enotsup} ->
 1527: 	    throw({skip,"Support for symlinks required"});
 1528: 	{error,eperm} ->
 1529: 	    %% On Windows, we may not have permissions to create symlinks.
 1530: 	    throw({skip,"Support for symlinks required"});
 1531: 	ok -> ok
 1532:     end,
 1533: 
 1534:     %% Compile the code.
 1535:     OnLoadAppEbin = filename:join(LinkName, "ebin"),
 1536:     {ok,_ } = compile:file(filename:join([OnLoadApp,"src",
 1537: 						"on_load_embedded"]),
 1538: 				 [{outdir,OnLoadAppEbin}]),
 1539: 
 1540:     %% Create and compile a boot file.
 1541:     true = code:add_pathz(OnLoadAppEbin),
 1542:     Options = case is_source_dir() of
 1543: 		  true -> [local];
 1544: 		  false -> []
 1545: 	      end,
 1546:     BootScript = create_boot(Config, Options),
 1547:     true = code:del_path(OnLoadAppEbin),
 1548: 
 1549:     %% Start the node and check that the on_load function was run.
 1550:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-mode", "embedded", "-boot", BootScript]),
 1551:     ok = rpc:call(Node, on_load_embedded, status, []),
 1552: 
 1553:     %% Clean up.
 1554:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1555: 
 1556: del_link(LinkName) ->
 1557:    case file:delete(LinkName) of
 1558:        {error,eperm} ->
 1559:              file:del_dir(LinkName);
 1560:        Other ->
 1561:        	     Other
 1562:    end.
 1563: 
 1564: create_boot(Config, Options) ->
 1565:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
 1566:     {LatestDir,LatestName} = create_script(Config),
 1567:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
 1568:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName, Options),
 1569:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
 1570:     filename:join(LatestDir, LatestName).
 1571: 
 1572: create_script(Config) ->
 1573:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1574:     Name = PrivDir ++ "on_load_test",
 1575:     Apps = application_controller:which_applications(),
 1576:     {value,{_,_,KernelVer}} = lists:keysearch(kernel, 1, Apps),
 1577:     {value,{_,_,StdlibVer}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib, 1, Apps),
 1578:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
 1579:     io:format(Fd,
 1580: 		    "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
 1581: 		    " {erts, \"9.42\"}, \n"
 1582: 		    " [{kernel, \"~s\"}, {stdlib, \"~s\"},"
 1583: 		    " {on_load_app, \"1.0\"}]}.\n",
 1584: 		    [KernelVer,StdlibVer]),
 1585:     file:close(Fd),
 1586:     {filename:dirname(Name),filename:basename(Name)}.
 1587: 
 1588: create_big_boot(Config) ->
 1589:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
 1590:     {Options,Local} = case is_source_dir() of
 1591: 				true -> {[no_module_tests,local],true};
 1592: 				_ -> {[no_module_tests],false}
 1593: 			    end,
 1594:     {LatestDir,LatestName,Apps} = create_big_script(Config,Local),
 1595:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
 1596:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName, Options),
 1597:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
 1598:     {filename:join(LatestDir, LatestName),Apps}.
 1599: 
 1600: %% The following apps cannot be loaded.
 1601: 
 1602: %% Orber requires explicit configuration
 1603: filter_app("orber",_) -> false;
 1604: 
 1605: %% cos* depends on orber
 1606: filter_app("cos"++_,_) -> false;
 1607: 
 1608: %% ic has a mod instruction in the app file but no corresponding start
 1609: %% function
 1610: filter_app("ic",_) -> false;
 1611: 
 1612: %% Netconf has some dependency that I really do not understand (maybe
 1613: %% like orber)
 1614: filter_app("netconf",_) -> false;
 1615: 
 1616: %% Safe has the same kind of error in the .app file as ic
 1617: filter_app("safe",_) -> false;
 1618: 
 1619: %% Comte cannot be started in the "usual" way
 1620: filter_app("comte",_) -> false;
 1621: 
 1622: %% OS_mon does not find its port program when running cerl
 1623: filter_app("os_mon",true) -> false;
 1624: 
 1625: %% erts is not a "real" app either =/
 1626: filter_app("erts",_) -> false;
 1627: 
 1628: %% wx* depends on that wxwidgets libs
 1629: filter_app("wx"++_,_) -> false;
 1630: 
 1631: %% Other apps should be OK.
 1632: filter_app(_,_) -> true.
 1633: 
 1634: create_big_script(Config,Local) ->
 1635:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1636:     Name = filename:join(PrivDir,"full_script_test"),
 1637:     InitialApplications=application:loaded_applications(),
 1638:     %% Applications left loaded by the application suite, unload them!
 1639:     UnloadFix=[app0,app1,app2,group_leader,app_start_error],
 1640:     [application:unload(Leftover) ||
 1641: 	      Leftover <- UnloadFix,
 1642: 	      lists:keymember(Leftover,1,InitialApplications) ],
 1643:     %% Now we should have only "real" applications...
 1644:     [application:load(list_to_atom(Y))
 1645: 	|| {match,[Y]} <- [re:run(X,code:lib_dir()++"/"++"([^/-]*).*/ebin",
 1646: 		[{capture,[1],list},unicode]) ||
 1647: 	    X <- code:get_path()],filter_app(Y,Local)],
 1648:     Apps = [ {N,V} || {N,_,V} <- application:loaded_applications()],
 1649:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
 1650:     io:format(Fd,
 1651: 		    "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
 1652: 		    " {erts, \"9.42\"}, \n"
 1653: 		    " ~p}.\n",
 1654: 		    [Apps]),
 1655:     file:close(Fd),
 1656:     NewlyLoaded =
 1657: 	application:loaded_applications() -- InitialApplications,
 1658:     [ application:unload(N) || {N,_,_} <- NewlyLoaded],
 1659:     {filename:dirname(Name),filename:basename(Name),Apps}.
 1660: 
 1661: is_source_dir() ->
 1662:     filename:basename(code:lib_dir(kernel)) =:= "kernel" andalso
 1663: 	filename:basename(code:lib_dir(stdlib)) =:= "stdlib".
 1664: 
 1665: on_load_errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1666:     Master = on_load_error_test_case_process,
 1667:     register(Master, self()),
 1668: 
 1669:     Data = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),"on_load_errors"]),
 1670:     ok = file:set_cwd(Data),
 1671:     up_to_date = make:all([{d,'MASTER',Master}]),
 1672: 
 1673:     do_on_load_error(an_atom),
 1674: 
 1675:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, self()),
 1676: 
 1677:     do_on_load_error({something,terrible,is,wrong}),
 1678:     receive
 1679: 	Any1 ->
 1680: 	    {_, "The on_load function"++_,
 1681: 		   [on_load_error,
 1682: 		    {something,terrible,is,wrong},_]} = Any1
 1683:     end,
 1684: 
 1685:     do_on_load_error(fail),		%Cause exception.
 1686:     receive
 1687: 	Any2 ->
 1688: 	    {_, "The on_load function"++_,
 1689: 		   [on_load_error,{failed,[_|_]},_]} = Any2
 1690:     end,
 1691: 
 1692:     %% There should be no more messages.
 1693:     receive
 1694: 	Unexpected ->
 1695: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Unexpected})
 1696:     after 10 ->
 1697: 	    ok
 1698:     end,
 1699: 
 1700:     %% Make sure that the code loading functions return the correct
 1701:     %% error code.
 1702:     Simple = simple_on_load_error,
 1703:     SimpleList = atom_to_list(Simple),
 1704:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_file(Simple),
 1705:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:ensure_loaded(Simple),
 1706:     {ok,SimpleCode} = file:read_file("simple_on_load_error.beam"),
 1707:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Simple, "", SimpleCode),
 1708:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_abs(SimpleList),
 1709:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_abs(SimpleList, Simple),
 1710: 
 1711:     ok.
 1712: 
 1713: do_on_load_error(ReturnValue) ->
 1714:     {_,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1715: 					  exit(on_load_error:main())
 1716: 				  end),
 1717:     receive {on_load_error,ErrorPid} -> ok end,
 1718:     ErrorPid ! ReturnValue,
 1719:     receive
 1720: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,Exit} ->
 1721: 	    {undef,[{on_load_error,main,[],_}|_]} = Exit
 1722:     end.
 1723: 
 1724: on_load_update(Config) ->
 1725:     {Mod,Code1} = on_load_update_code(1),
 1726:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1),
 1727:     42 = Mod:a(),
 1728:     100 = Mod:b(99),
 1729:     4 = erlang:trace_pattern({Mod,'_','_'}, true),
 1730: 
 1731:     {Mod,Code2} = on_load_update_code(2),
 1732:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code2),
 1733:     42 = Mod:a(),
 1734:     78 = Mod:b(77),
 1735:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:never()),
 1736:     4 = erlang:trace_pattern({Mod,'_','_'}, false),
 1737: 
 1738:     {Mod,Code3} = on_load_update_code(3),
 1739:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code3),
 1740:     100 = Mod:c(),
 1741:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:a()),
 1742:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:b(10)),
 1743:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:never()),
 1744: 
 1745:     code:purge(Mod),
 1746:     code:delete(Mod),
 1747:     code:purge(Mod),
 1748:     ok.
 1749: 
 1750: on_load_update_code(Version) ->
 1751:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1752:     Tree = on_load_update_code_1(Version, Mod),
 1753:     io:format("Version ~p", [Version]),
 1754:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1755:     merl:print(Tree),
 1756:     io:nl(),
 1757:     {Mod,Code}.
 1758: 
 1759: on_load_update_code_1(1, Mod) ->
 1760:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1761: 	"-export([a/0,b/1]).\n"
 1762: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1763: 	"f() -> ok.\n",
 1764: 	"a() -> 42.\n"
 1765: 	"b(I) -> I+1.\n"]);
 1766: on_load_update_code_1(2, Mod) ->
 1767:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1768: 	"-export([never/0]).\n"
 1769: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1770: 	"f() -> 42 = '@Mod@':a(), 1 = '@Mod@':b(0), fail.\n",
 1771: 	"never() -> never.\n"]);
 1772: on_load_update_code_1(3, Mod) ->
 1773:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1774: 	"-export([c/0]).\n"
 1775: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1776: 	"f() -> ok.\n",
 1777: 	"c() -> 100.\n"]).
 1778: 
 1779: %% Test -on_load while trace feature 'on_load' is enabled (OTP-14612)
 1780: on_load_trace_on_load(Config) ->
 1781:     %% 'on_load' enables tracing for all newly loaded modules, so we make a dry
 1782:     %% run to ensure that ancillary modules like 'merl' won't be loaded during
 1783:     %% the actual test.
 1784:     on_load_update(Config),
 1785: 
 1786:     Papa = self(),
 1787:     Tracer = spawn_link(fun F() -> receive M -> Papa ! M end, F() end),
 1788:     {tracer,[]} = erlang:trace_info(self(),tracer),
 1789:     erlang:trace(self(), true, [call, {tracer, Tracer}]),
 1790:     erlang:trace_pattern(on_load, true, []),
 1791:     on_load_update(Config),
 1792:     erlang:trace_pattern(on_load, false, []),
 1793:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]),
 1794: 
 1795:     Ms = flush(),
 1796:     [{trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, a, []}},
 1797:      {trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, b, [99]}},
 1798:      {trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, c, []}}] = Ms,
 1799: 
 1800:     exit(Tracer, normal),
 1801:     ok.
 1802: 
 1803: flush() ->
 1804:     receive M -> [M | flush()]
 1805:     after 100 -> []
 1806:     end.
 1807: 
 1808: on_load_purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1809:     run_purge_test(fun on_load_purge_test/1, Config).
 1810: 
 1811: on_load_purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1812:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1813:     register(Mod, self()),
 1814:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1815: 	       "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1816: 	       "loop() -> loop().\n",
 1817: 	       "f() ->\n",
 1818: 	       "'@Mod@' ! {self(),spawn(fun loop/0)},\n",
 1819: 	       "receive Ack -> Ack end.\n"]),
 1820:     merl:print(Tree),
 1821:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1822:     P = spawn(fun() ->
 1823: 		      exit(code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code))
 1824: 	      end),
 1825:     monitor(process, P),
 1826:     receive
 1827: 	{Pid1,Pid2} ->
 1828: 	    monitor(process, Pid2),
 1829: 	    Pid1 ! ack_and_failure,
 1830: 	    receive
 1831: 		{'DOWN',_,process,P,Exit1} ->
 1832: 		    {error,on_load_failure} = Exit1
 1833: 	    end,
 1834: 	    receive
 1835: 		{'DOWN',_,process,Pid2,Exit2} ->
 1836: 		    io:format("~p\n", [Exit2])
 1837: 	    after 10000 ->
 1838: 		    ct:fail(no_down_message)
 1839: 	    end
 1840:     end,
 1841:     unregister(Mod),
 1842:     ok.
 1843: 
 1844: on_load_self_call(_Config) ->
 1845:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1846:     register(Mod, self()),
 1847:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1848: 	       "-export([ext/0]).\n",
 1849: 	       "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1850: 	       "f() ->\n",
 1851: 	       "  '@Mod@' ! (catch '@Mod@':ext()),\n",
 1852: 	       "  ok.\n",
 1853: 	       "ext() -> good_work.\n"]),
 1854:         merl:print(Tree),
 1855:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1856: 
 1857:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = on_load_do_load(Mod, Code),
 1858:     good_work = on_load_do_load(Mod, Code),
 1859: 
 1860:     ok.
 1861: 
 1862: on_load_do_load(Mod, Code) ->
 1863:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1864:                        {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1865:                end),
 1866:     receive
 1867: 	Any -> Any
 1868:     end.
 1869: 
 1870: on_load_pending(_Config) ->
 1871:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1872:     Tree1 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1873: 		"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1874: 		"f() ->\n",
 1875: 		"  register('@Mod@', self()),\n",
 1876: 		"  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 1877:     merl:print(Tree1),
 1878:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = merl:compile(Tree1),
 1879: 
 1880:     Tree2 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1881: 		"-export([t/0]).\n",
 1882: 		"t() -> ok.\n"]),
 1883:     merl:print(Tree2),
 1884:     {ok,Mod,Code2} = merl:compile(Tree2),
 1885: 
 1886:     Self = self(),
 1887:     {_,Ref1} =
 1888: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1889: 			      Self ! started1,
 1890: 			      {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1)
 1891: 		      end),
 1892:     receive started1 -> ok end,
 1893:     timer:sleep(10),
 1894:     {_,Ref2} =
 1895: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1896: 			      Self ! started2,
 1897: 			      {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code2),
 1898: 			      ok = Mod:t()
 1899: 		      end),
 1900:     receive started2 -> ok end,
 1901:     receive
 1902: 	Unexpected ->
 1903: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Unexpected})
 1904:     after 100 ->
 1905: 	    ok
 1906:     end,
 1907:     Mod ! go,
 1908:     receive
 1909: 	{'DOWN',Ref1,process,_,normal} -> ok
 1910:     end,
 1911:     receive
 1912: 	{'DOWN',Ref2,process,_,normal} -> ok
 1913:     end,
 1914:     ok = Mod:t(),
 1915:     ok.
 1916: 
 1917: on_load_deleted(_Config) ->
 1918:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1919: 
 1920:     R0 = fun() ->
 1921: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1922: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1923: 			    "f() -> ok.\n"]),
 1924: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1925: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1926: 		 {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1927: 	 end,
 1928:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R0),
 1929:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R0),
 1930: 
 1931:     R1 = fun() ->
 1932: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1933: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1934: 			    "f() -> fail.\n"]),
 1935: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1936: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1937: 		 {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1938: 	 end,
 1939:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R1),
 1940:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R1),
 1941: 
 1942:     OtherMod = list_to_atom(lists:concat([Mod,"_42"])),
 1943:     OtherTree = ?Q(["-module('@OtherMod@').\n"]),
 1944:     merl:print(OtherTree),
 1945:     {ok,OtherMod,OtherCode} = merl:compile(OtherTree),
 1946: 
 1947:     R2 = fun() ->
 1948: 		 RegName = 'on_load__registered_name',
 1949: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1950: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1951: 			    "f() ->\n",
 1952: 			    "  register('@RegName@', self()),\n",
 1953: 			    "  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 1954: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1955: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1956: 		 spawn_link(fun() ->
 1957:                                     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1958:                             end),
 1959: 		 receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1960: 		 {module,OtherMod} = code:load_binary(OtherMod, "",
 1961: 						      OtherCode),
 1962: 		 RegName ! stop
 1963: 	 end,
 1964:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R2),
 1965: 
 1966:     ok.
 1967: 
 1968: on_load_deadlock(Config) ->
 1969:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1970:     register(Mod, self()),
 1971:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1972:                "-export([ext/0]).\n",
 1973:                "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1974:                "f() ->\n",
 1975:                "  timer:sleep(1000),\n",
 1976:                "  '@Mod@':ext().\n",
 1977:                "ext() -> ok.\n"]),
 1978:     merl:print(Tree),
 1979:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1980: 
 1981:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1982:     File = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".beam"),
 1983:     ok = file:write_file(File, Code),
 1984:     code:add_path(Dir),
 1985: 
 1986:     spawn(fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(Mod) end),
 1987:     {error,Reason} = code:ensure_loaded(Mod),
 1988:     true = (Reason =:= deadlock) or (Reason =:= on_load_failure),
 1989: 
 1990:     code:del_path(Dir),
 1991:     ok.
 1992: 
 1993: delete_before_reload(Mod, Reload) ->
 1994:     false = check_old_code(Mod),
 1995: 
 1996:     Tree1 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1997: 		"-export([f/1]).\n",
 1998: 		"f(Parent) ->\n",
 1999: 		"  register('@Mod@', self()),\n",
 2000: 		"  Parent ! started,\n",
 2001: 		"  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 2002:     merl:print(Tree1),
 2003:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = merl:compile(Tree1),
 2004: 
 2005:     Self = self(),
 2006:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 2007:                        {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1),
 2008:                        Mod:f(Self)
 2009:                end),
 2010:     receive started -> ok end,
 2011: 
 2012:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 2013:     true = check_old_code(Mod),
 2014: 
 2015:     Reload(),
 2016: 
 2017:     %% When loading the the module with the -on_load() function,
 2018:     %% the reference to the old code would be lost. Make sure that
 2019:     %% the old code is remembered and is still preventing the
 2020:     %% purge.
 2021:     false = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 2022: 
 2023:     %% Get rid of the old code.
 2024:     Mod ! stop,
 2025:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
 2026:     true = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 2027: 
 2028:     %% Unload the version of the module with the -on_load() function.
 2029:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 2030:     true = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 2031: 
 2032:     ok.
 2033: 
 2034: %% Test that the mode of the code server is properly retrieved.
 2035: get_mode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2036:     interactive = code:get_mode().
 2037: 
 2038: %% Make sure that the paths for all loaded modules have been normalized.
 2039: normalized_paths(_Config) ->
 2040:     do_normalized_paths(erlang:loaded()).
 2041: 
 2042: do_normalized_paths([M|Ms]) ->
 2043:     case code:which(M) of
 2044: 	Special when is_atom(Special) ->
 2045: 	    do_normalized_paths(Ms);
 2046: 	File when is_list(File) ->
 2047: 	    File = filename:join([File]),
 2048: 	    do_normalized_paths(Ms)
 2049:     end;
 2050: do_normalized_paths([]) ->
 2051:     ok.
 2052: 
 2053: %% Make sure that the extra -mode flags are ignored
 2054: mult_embedded_flags(_Config) ->
 2055:     Modes = [{["-mode", "embedded"], embedded},
 2056: 	     {["-mode", "interactive"], interactive},
 2057: 	     {["-mode", "invalid"], interactive}],
 2058: 
 2059:     [ begin
 2060: 	  {ArgMode, ExpectedMode} = Mode,
 2061: 	  {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(ArgMode),
