 2062: 	  ExpectedMode = rpc:call(Node, code, get_mode, []),
 2063: 	  peer:stop(Peer)
 2064:       end || Mode <- Modes],
 2065: 
 2066:     [ begin
 2067: 	  {ArgIgnoredMode, _} = IgnoredMode,
 2068: 	  {ArgRelevantMode, ExpectedMode} = RelevantMode,
 2069: 	  {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(ArgRelevantMode ++ ArgIgnoredMode),
 2070: 	  ExpectedMode = rpc:call(Node, code, get_mode, []),
 2071: 	  peer:stop(Peer)
 2072:       end || IgnoredMode <- Modes, RelevantMode <- Modes],
 2073:     ok.
 2074: 
 2075: %% Test that module_status/1 behaves as expected
 2076: module_status(_Config) ->
 2077:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 2078:         true ->
 2079:             module_status();
 2080:         false ->
 2081:             %% Make sure that we terminate the cover server.
 2082:             try
 2083:                 module_status()
 2084:             after
 2085:                 cover:stop()
 2086:             end
 2087:     end.
 2088: 
 2089: module_status() ->
 2090:     %% basics
 2091:     not_loaded = code:module_status(fubar),     % nonexisting
 2092:     {file, preloaded} = code:is_loaded(erlang),
 2093:     loaded = code:module_status(erlang),        % preloaded
 2094:     loaded = code:module_status(?MODULE),       % normal known loaded
 2095: 
 2096:     %% module_status/0 returns status for each loaded module
 2097:     true = (lists:sort([{M, code:module_status(M)}
 2098:                         || {M, _} <- code:all_loaded()])
 2099:             =:= lists:sort(code:module_status())),
 2100: 
 2101:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify dummy name not in path
 2102:     code:purge(?TESTMOD), % ensure no previous version in memory
 2103:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2104:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
 2105: 
 2106:     %% generated code is detected as such
 2107:     {ok,?TESTMOD,Bin} = compile:forms(dummy_ast(), []),
 2108:     {module,?TESTMOD} = code:load_binary(?TESTMOD,"",Bin),  % no source file
 2109:     ok = ?TESTMOD:f(),
 2110:     "" = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify empty string for source file
 2111:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2112: 
 2113:     %% module_status/1 also accepts a list of modules
 2114:     [] = code:module_status([]),
 2115:     [{erlang, loaded},{?MODULE,loaded},{?TESTMOD,loaded}] =
 2116:         code:module_status([erlang, ?MODULE, ?TESTMOD]),
 2117: 
 2118:     %% deleting generated code
 2119:     true = code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2120:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify still not in path
 2121:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2122: 
 2123:     %% beam file exists but not loaded
 2124:     make_source_file(<<"0">>),
 2125:     compile_beam(0),
 2126:     true = (non_existing =/= code:which(?TESTMOD)), % verify in path
 2127:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2128: 
 2129:     %% loading code from disk makes it loaded
 2130:     load_code(),
 2131:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loaded
 2132: 
 2133:     %% cover compiling a module
 2134:     {ok,?TESTMOD} = cover:compile(?TESTMOD),
 2135:     {file, cover_compiled} = code:is_loaded(?TESTMOD), % verify cover compiled
 2136:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loaded cover code but file exists
 2137:     remove_code(),
 2138:     removed = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % removed
 2139:     compile_beam(0),
 2140:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % recreated
 2141:     load_code(),
 2142:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loading removes cover status
 2143:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
 2144:     true = code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2145:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % deleted
 2146: 
 2147:     %% recompilation ignores timestamps, only md5 matters
 2148:     load_code(),
 2149:     compile_beam(1100),
 2150:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2151: 
 2152:     %% modifying module detects different md5
 2153:     make_source_file(<<"1">>),
 2154:     compile_beam(0),
 2155:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2156: 
 2157:     %% loading the modified code from disk makes it loaded
 2158:     load_code(),
 2159:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2160: 
 2161:     %% removing and recreating a module with same md5
 2162:     remove_code(),
 2163:     removed = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2164:     compile_beam(0),
 2165:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2166: 
 2167:     ok.
 2168: 
 2169: compile_beam(Sleep) ->
 2170:     compile(Sleep, []).
 2171: 
 2172: compile(Sleep, Opts) ->
 2173:     timer:sleep(Sleep),  % increment compilation timestamp
 2174:     {ok,?TESTMOD} = compile:file(?TESTMODSRC, Opts).
 2175: 
 2176: load_code() ->
 2177:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
 2178:     {module,?TESTMOD} = code:load_file(?TESTMOD).
 2179: 
 2180: remove_code() ->
 2181:     ok = file:delete(?TESTMODOBJ).
 2182: 
 2183: make_source_file(Body) ->
 2184:     ok = file:write_file(?TESTMODSRC, dummy_source(Body)).
 2185: 
 2186: dummy_source(Body) ->
 2187:     [<<"-module(" ?TESTMODSTR ").\n"
 2188:        "-export([f/0]).\n"
 2189:        "f() -> ">>, Body, <<".\n">>].
 2190: 
 2191: dummy_ast() ->
 2192:     dummy_ast(?TESTMODSTR).
 2193: 
 2194: dummy_ast(Mod) when is_atom(Mod) ->
 2195:     dummy_ast(atom_to_list(Mod));
 2196: dummy_ast(ModStr) ->
 2197:     [scan_form("-module(" ++ ModStr ++ ")."),
 2198:      scan_form("-export([f/0])."),
 2199:      scan_form("f() -> ok.")].
 2200: 
 2201: scan_form(String) ->
 2202:     {ok,Ts,_} = erl_scan:string(String),
 2203:     {ok,F} = erl_parse:parse_form(Ts),
 2204:     F.
 2205: 
 2206: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2207: %% error_logger handler.
 2208: %% (Copied from stdlib/test/proc_lib_SUITE.erl.)
 2209: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2210: init(Tester) ->
 2211:     {ok, Tester}.
 2212: 
 2213: handle_event({warning_msg, _GL, Msg}, Tester) ->
 2214:     Tester ! Msg,
 2215:     {ok, Tester};
 2216: handle_event(_Event, State) ->
 2217:     {ok, State}.
 2218: 
 2219: handle_info(_, State) ->
 2220:     {ok, State}.
 2221: 
 2222: handle_call(_Query, State) -> {ok, {error, bad_query}, State}.
 2223: 
 2224: terminate(_Reason, State) ->
 2225:     State.
 2226: 
 2227: %%%
 2228: %%% Common utility functions.
 2229: %%%
 2230: 
 2231: run_purge_test(Test, Config) ->
 2232:     OSRL = erlang:system_info(outstanding_system_requests_limit),
 2233:     
 2234:     TestLowOSRL = case OSRL < 10 of
 2235:                       true -> 1;
 2236:                       false -> 5
 2237:                   end,
 2238: 
 2239:     io:format("Running with the default outstanding request limit of ~p~n", [OSRL]),
 2240:     Res1 = Test(Config),
 2241:     io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Res1]),
 2242:     try
 2243:         %% Run again with low limit and many processes...
 2244:         Procs = case erlang:system_info(process_limit) of
 2245:                     PLim when PLim < 20000 ->
 2246:                         erlang:system_info(process_limit) div 2;
 2247:                     _ ->
 2248:                         10000
 2249:                 end,
 2250:         erlang:system_flag(outstanding_system_requests_limit, TestLowOSRL),
 2251:         io:format("Running with outstanding request limit of ~p~n", [TestLowOSRL]),
 2252:         Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2253:                                spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end)
 2254:                        end, lists:seq(1, Procs)),
 2255:         Res2 = Test(Config),
 2256:         lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 2257:                               unlink(P),
 2258:                               exit(P, kill)
 2259:                       end, Ps),
 2260:         lists:foreach(fun (P) -> is_process_alive(P) end, Ps),
 2261:         io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Res2]),
 2262:         {Res1, Res2}
 2263:     after
 2264:         TestLowOSRL = erlang:system_flag(outstanding_system_requests_limit, OSRL)
 2265:     end.
